headline: Coffee and Donuts Tiramisu
description: Mini powdered donuts are dipped in strong coffee, layered with creamy, sweet pudding, and sprinkled with cocoa powder, resulting in the easiest version of tiramisu ever.
name: Coffee and Donuts Tiramisu
recipeIngredient: 1 (3.4 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix
1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed
1 (12 ounce) package small powdered sugar donuts

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk milk and pudding mix together in a large bowl until smooth. Fold in whipped topping and set aside.

Pour coffee into a shallow bowl. Dip one donut into the coffee and hold for 5 to 10 seconds on each side. Place in the bottom of an 8-inch square baking dish. Repeat with 11 more donuts to fill the bottom of the dish.
Spread 1/2 of the pudding mixture over the donuts. Repeat the process with remaining 12 donuts and pudding mixture. Lightly sprinkle cocoa powder over top.
Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight. Serve chilled.

review.reviewBody: It's so good...Especially the mixture....But whole thing together when you take the first bite is so good.

The taste is great, though I don't think my coffee was strong enough because I could barely taste the coffee flavor. The one issue I had was the fact that 1, 10oz bag of mini donuts was not enough for two layers. I had to run back to the store in the middle of putting this together to get another bag of mini donuts (and that bag barely had enough for a full second layer). I'll make this again though!

It turned out alright. I like tiramisu stuff so had to try it. The only thing I had to do different was change the donut. I just didn't see a powder donut going with tiramisu. So I did mini cake donuts and dipped them in the coffee. Had it all sit over night. It was good but I won't make again.
